intro: Xanthoxalis cymosa, commonly known as the clustered goldenweed, is a herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features delicate yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, giving it its common name. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Xanthoxalis cymosa typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks.
